programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Italy is the land of fashion, design and the most exciting cars of the world. Ferrari, Lamborghini, Maserati and Alfa Romeo are considered the epitomes for breathtaking cars, designed with stunning shapes, vivacious engines and incomparable passion.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: American muscle cars are iconic vehicles, bursting with power. Whether it is the Ford Mustang, the Chevrolet Camaro or the Corvette, these cars are coveted all over the world because of their rebellious design, impeteous horsepower and stunning speed.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Beauties like the Corvette, Mustang, Camaro or Shelby Cobra represent the American dream of freedom. These spectacular cars with their massive bonnets, lush chrome dÃ©cor and large tail fins excite enthusisasts since the 1950s.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1971 BMW 02 Touring was considered an ugly duckling at the time, but is now a coveted car. Also: the solid technology and moderate prices of the Mercedes-Benz 114/115 made them the first "people's Mercedes".

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The Porsche 911 Targa with its lightweight construction is an iconic car. Also: the Lotus Seven Twin Cam SS is more pf a race than a road car. And: the 1930 Bentley Blower and the dainty British roadster, the Sunbeam Tiger.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1967 Ford Fairlane GTA in NASCAR trim. Also: the 1995 Chrysler 300 C was the most powerful production vehicle in the US. And: the 1949 Cadillac Series 62 convertible set new standards in terms of luxury.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1947 Triumph 1800 Roadster provides space for 5 fresh air fans. Also: Le Jog, the toughest classic car rally in Europe. A German women's team takes on the challenge in their VW Iltis. And: a charming oldie, the 1919 Wolseley Stellite.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: An angry bull, a few Englishmen who prepared themselves for rather unpleasant weather conditions and a young, talented race driver, these were all visitors who ventured to the infamous Green Hell of the Nürburgring.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: A tuned-up Golf 2, a family sedan from Hanover, Germany and a very special Porsche GT2. We looked behind the scenes of the gas station by the curve on the race track where sports cars flock.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: When the Nürburgring transforms into a winter wonderland, it may look pleasant but sure isn't too pleasant as a race track.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Fog, rain and snow means that a visit to the Eifel region isn't too pleasant. Nevertheless, the toughest drivers were at the track, not letting the weather get in their way.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes rehearse a car crash scene for a movie, in which it should seem as if the main character of the movie really drives the car. The team achieves this directive by using digital effects and constructing a special airbag.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Stunt coordinator Christoph looks back at the stunts of the last twelve shows and explains why a stunt sometimes works better in a test than on the film set. It's a summary of all the stunts of season 2, in addition to the best outtakes.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: After the shoot of the second season of this series, the stunt team created 13 little action movie sequences on their own that are sometimes funny, sometimes gritty, sometimes a bit mad, but always spectacular.

programme.title: Jeep Renegade
programme.desc: Jeep has been building SUVs since 1942. The Jeep Renegade comes from a traditional home. It is the youngest representative of the family and the most successful.

programme.title: Mitsubishi Lancer Evo 10
programme.desc: The ice course on Lungauring, the Mitsubishi Lancer Evo 10 in winter training. Twelve participants in six Evos were taught the art of drifting with a four-wheel drive car. We accompanied a student on his first drifting experience.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: BMW F 800 R is a robust roadster with a lot of spirit, and even motorcycle world champions count on its agility. World champion, Chris Pfeiffer is showing just how much fun you can have with a BMW F 800 R. His work motorcycle is based on the version that you can buy.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: In this episode we followed W Motors when they presented their 3.4 million dollar prototype of the Lykan HyperSport at the Dubai Motor Show, where the twin turbo flat six 770 hp engine came alive in the fully assembled super sports car for the first time. Then, the Lykan underwent its first high speed test drive at the Dubai Motodrome.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Driving the Porsche Cayman GTS is like riding a bullet, it's a constant thrill, but in a controllable surrounding. On the sunny island of Mallorca we made this fun machine climb hills and take on a race track. In addition: the state-of-the-art Corvette C7 in a Wild West theme park. And: the Nissan 370 Z Nismo, an affordable sportscar from the manufacturer's house tuner with an individual style.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: If you're a passionate sports car fan and a family person at the same time, don't worry, as there are ways to combine both of these passions. The E 63 S AMG T with its V8 biturbo engine is as fast as a sportscar can be and takes you and your family wherever you want. In addition: the Audi RS6. And: the G-Power Hurrican with 750 hp.

programme.title: Alpina B6
programme.desc: An Alpina is optically never intrusive. Understatement is the motto. One should not recognize at first glance, what potential is hidden under the bodywork. Huge spoilers are not used and neither are striking power domes. Any modifications serve the technical improvement, for example, optimized cooling and aerodynamics.

programme.title: Lexus LS600h
programme.desc: Lexus is a pioneer in the construction of modern hybrid vehicles. In 2007 the Toyota brand's premium marque introduced the LS 600h with a combination of electric and combustion drive.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The emphatically sporty cars and motorbikes of BMW are equally successful with customers and in racing. However, the former aircraft engine manufacturer's entry into automobile production threatened to fail at an early stage.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Porsche 550 Spyder is small and fast, but only 140 units were built. It was Porsche's first racing sports car and laid the foundation for the German manufacturer to be considered a force in car racing today.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Racing has been a matter of the heart for Ford for over 100 years. Henry Ford already wins the first race with his first car. Thousands of other victories were to follow.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The development of engineering at BMW has always been closely linked to motorsport. Racing has always played a decisive role in shaping the brand and setting the pace for its future.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: In the 1980s and 90s, Porsche races from victory to victory. A McLaren with Porsche engine wins the Formula 1 World Championship three times. In Le Mans in 1982, Porsche starts an unbelievable winning streak with the new 956/962 prototype.

programme.title: Glas 1700 GT
programme.desc: The Glas GT looks like a Ferrari, but comes from the province of Lower Bavaria in Germany. In the early 1960s it was one of the few German sports cars.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: The 2024 Belgian Rally Championship starts with the Rally van Haspengouw in Landen.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 2 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the Rally des Ardennes, takes place in Dinant.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Tielt is the location of round 3 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the TAC Rally.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 4 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the 41st Rallye de Wallonie, will go down in history as one of the most hotly contested ever.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 5 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the 47th edition of the Sezoensrally, traditionally took place on the third Saturday of May.

programme.title: Audi R8 V10 plus
programme.desc: The second generation of the Audi R8. V10 naturally aspirated engine, up to 610 horsepower and 330 kilometers an hour. A supercar with a lot of character.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Smart offers its iconic city car with a convertible option. The Mini cabriolet is bigger and provides room for four people. When it comes to roadster feeling, the Mazda MX-5 is on top of the list. We took a closer look at these three open-top contenders.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The Paris Motor Show features the automotive world of tomorrow. In 2016 Mercedes-Benz introduced their “Generation EQ” and Volkswagen announced to build 20 new electrified models by 2020, possibly in order to distract from the emission scandal.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What would make coupe fans opt for a more traditional two-door model like the Mercedes-Benz E400 instead of its bigger brother, the CLS with four doors? Also: does the Volkswagen Arteon stand a chance against the Mercedes CLS?

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Winning the iconic Dakar Rally for a record 13 times, Frenchman Stéphane Peterhansel had a rather unusual career as he switched from motorbikes to cars and was enormously successful with both vehicles.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Alois Ruf is the founder of a small, but well-known car manufacturing company in Bavaria that specialises in building their own vision of street legal super sports cars on the foundation of Porsche bodys.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: From the 1950s to 1970s Hans Herrmann came to fame as a successful Formula 1 and sportscar driver for manufacturers like Porsche, Mercedes-Benz and Maserati who also won also the 24 Hours of Le Mans several times.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: When Land Rover decided to end their production of the Defender after more than 60 years, a successor needed to be determined. Also: the SsangYong Rexton, the Jeep Renegade and our pick of the top 5 off-roaders.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.sub-title: Alpina B5 Touring vs. Jaguar XF Sportbrake
programme.desc: The Audi RS6 and the Mercedes E63 AMG are the two top sportsters among station wagons. Alpina came up with the B5 Twin Turbo, their BMW-based answer to the competition. Also: the agile Skoda Octavia Combi. And: the Jaguar XF Sportbrake.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The off-road specialists from Delta 4x4 turned a Volkswagen Amarok into their so-called Beast and challenged Toyota off-road expert Alexander Wohlfarth in his Toyota Hilux. Which one of these 4x4 powerhouses fares better?

programme.title: Cadillac Escalade
programme.desc: The Cadillac Escalade at first seems like a typical rather beefy American car, but this luxurious SUV is more of a lovable, gentle giant, that should be able to gain sympathy with its clientele.

programme.title: Seat Alhambra
programme.desc: Although the Seat Alhambra doesn’t look particularly sporty, but when tested by two professional bikers, it shows that it is not to be underestimated.

programme.title: KIA Sorento
programme.desc: The Sorento is the flagship vehicle in the KIA model range. The Korean manufacturer hopes to conquer the premium SUV market by offering good quality at an attractive price. Does the Sorento meet the standards of a premium class vehicle?

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The emphatically sporty cars and motorbikes of BMW are equally successful with customers and in racing. However, the former aircraft engine manufacturer's entry into automobile production threatened to fail at an early stage.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Porsche 550 Spyder is small and fast, but only 140 units were built. It was Porsche's first racing sports car and laid the foundation for the German manufacturer to be considered a force in car racing today.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Racing has been a matter of the heart for Ford for over 100 years. Henry Ford already wins the first race with his first car. Thousands of other victories were to follow.
